name: CNN
text:
The Voting Rights Act, enforcing the 14th and 15th Amendments and combating voter suppression tactics, was signed into law on August 6, 1965.

Since then, registration for Black voters has increased over the decades. https://t.co/TFaIU0AImf

name: CNN
text:
In 2012, for the first time, the gap between registered Black and White voters nearly closed entirely.

But since 2012, the gap has widened again across all demographic groups, especially for Black voters, according to US Census Bureau data. https://t.co/nPC3BADBy0 https://t.co/p88N567rqU

name: CNN
text: The registration gap has become increasingly notable in a handful of battleground states that will be crucial to the outcome of this year's election. https://t.co/goqvKNm2gZ

name: CNN
text: Swing states like Arizona, Florida, Michigan and Pennsylvania have experienced some of the largest decreases in voter registration among Black and Hispanic voters between the 2014 and 2018 midterms. https://t.co/ZhhXJ6xsoM https://t.co/bMBdVFXEF5

name: CNN
text: Census data shows that voter registration has increased for white voters in each of those six battlegrounds over the same period, however. https://t.co/SZ7I3rFtAV

name: CNN
text:
The typical ways that voters have registered in the past have become nearly non-existent amid the pandemic.

Ahead of the 2016 election, Census data shows that a majority of voters registered in person through a government office or another community venue https://t.co/AMU2yZjFt4 https://t.co/0MwGBllRd4

name: CNN
text: Facebook is extending its work from home policy until July of next year, becoming the latest tech giant to commit to letting staff work remotely in response to the coronavirus pandemic https://t.co/6QcV5neic1
